page.title: 03GREAT OFFLEY, contd.
page.content: Offley has a cricket pitch with woods nearby, and there is fishing in Long Pond. There is a small park with a slide and roundabout for the children. Opposite Pond House are private livery stables. By the crossroads there is a small public garden, where people may sit quietly, called Pond Garden; this could be a nice spot but is spoiled by much litter. At night, the lights of the pubs are very pretty, but the Green Man is very noisy and the many visitors cause parking problems. Most weekends, the Riding Club holds some kind of show at the old football ground. There is a general shop and Post Office near the crossroads and a butcher's shop in the High Street. The roads are easy to cross since Offley was by-passed and there are many long walks in the country around. The people of Offley are very friendly.
